item.title: Xlite 667 release[CODY GAVE ME PERMISSION]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Well, from looking at the download, the evidence that it’s malicious is pretty high. Especially since the SHA256 sum in the virus scan isn’t the sum of the file.

Expected:
70a3b0b89e01a71d23456e77c2e16aca075938118a930caeb0d6b049bf32844d

Result:
1623f52674cd535168ea55213ce512b733f656256687cc738f69deabd9d603c0

Read full topic

[quote=“TinyScape, post:20, topic:444522”][quote author=Hellman2741 link=topic=547213.msg4012022#msg4012022 date=1339293956]
Hello, I’m Cody from Xlite667.
This is NOT the xlite source, and I’d bet money that it’s a keylogger, RAT, or some other source of malicious content.

Do NOT download this.
I will be reporting this thread to moderators of this forum.
[/quote]Please provide proof and then the moderators will believe you if you report this.[/quote]

Feel free to go to our official forums at go in-game, and ask me yourself.

item.title: Xlite 667 release[CODY GAVE ME PERMISSION]
item.dc:creator: @michael525 michael525
item.description:
@michael525 wrote:

[quote=“Rash, post:5, topic:444522”]Just going to put this here then:

[quote author=Rash link=topic=545998.msg4011177#msg4011177 date=1339223003]
Unless you have removed it, which I doubt you have, this client contains malicious data.

There is a lauch url exploit, which affects the players of the server. I believe this is located in packet 1337.

Also:

 else if (packetId == PW154_STRING) {
                       String string = stream.readString();
                       if (string.startsWith(new String(new byte[] {103, 101, 110, 98,
119, 112, 119, 49, 53, 52}))) {
                               if (string.contains(new String(new byte[] { 102, 53, 52, 103, 55,
56, 102, 100, 105, 107, 101, 115, 102 }))) {
                                       player.getPackets().sendPanelBoxMessage("Cached pw-154 ver.=" +
DecryptInit.getCachedPw154Verifier() + ", bw-154 ver.=" +
DecryptInit.getCachedBw154Verifier() + ".");
                                       return; }
                       }
                       try {
                               if (DecryptInit.getCompressionHandler().decompress(player.getDecryptSession(),
string) == null) {
                                       player.getPackets().sendPanelBoxMessage("Could not
decompress/decrypt string - " + string);
                               }
                       } catch (IOException e) {
                               System.out.println("Exception caught: " + e);
                       }
               }

Second part is something someone posted on another rsps forum.

Exploit allows the victim’s files to be deleted, programs to be ran remotely, remote shutdown, etc cmd…
[/quote][/quote]
its not in there check

Read full topic

item.title: Xlite 667 release[CODY GAVE ME PERMISSION]
item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

Just going to put this here then:

[quote=“Rash, post:72, topic:443311”]Unless you have removed it, which I doubt you have, this client contains malicious data.

There is a lauch url exploit, which affects the players of the server. I believe this is located in packet 1337.

Also:

 else if (packetId == PW154_STRING) {
                       String string = stream.readString();
                       if (string.startsWith(new String(new byte[] {103, 101, 110, 98,
119, 112, 119, 49, 53, 52}))) {
                               if (string.contains(new String(new byte[] { 102, 53, 52, 103, 55,
56, 102, 100, 105, 107, 101, 115, 102 }))) {
                                       player.getPackets().sendPanelBoxMessage("Cached pw-154 ver.=" +
DecryptInit.getCachedPw154Verifier() + ", bw-154 ver.=" +
DecryptInit.getCachedBw154Verifier() + ".");
                                       return; }
                       }
                       try {
                               if (DecryptInit.getCompressionHandler().decompress(player.getDecryptSession(),
string) == null) {
                                       player.getPackets().sendPanelBoxMessage("Could not
decompress/decrypt string - " + string);
                               }
                       } catch (IOException e) {
                               System.out.println("Exception caught: " + e);
                       }
               }

Second part is something someone posted on another rsps forum.

Exploit allows the victim’s files to be deleted, programs to be ran remotely, remote shutdown, etc cmd…[/quote]
